headline.main: LAVAL'S PAPER PLANT BOMBED BY GAULLISTS; Vichy Says British Planes Dropped 'Pencil Detonators'

lead_paragraph: BERNE, Switzerland, Aug. 1 -- Three bombs exploding in Clermont-Ferrand have done considerable damage to the printing plant of Chief of Government Pierre Laval's newspaper, the Moniteur. Vichy said the explosives were "pencil detonators" dropped by British airplanes to followers of Gen. Charles de Gaulle.
abstract: De Gaullists bomb printing plant of Premier Laval's newspaper, the Moniteur, Clermont-Ferrand, France
